DataElement.preferredName: Cigarette Average Daily Pack Use Integer::1 Decimal Place Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place average number of packs of cigarettes smoked per day.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to statistical calculation describing the central tendency of daily use of packs of cigarettes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.(NCI)

Concepts.definition: Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.

Property.preferredDefinition: The central tendency of a set of n numbers; lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered.:Occurring or done each day.:A number of individual items packaged as a unit.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.
A number of individual items packaged as a unit.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
